Question: We are faced with many problems in this country, none of which can be solved easily or inexpensively. I'm going to name some of these problems, and for each one I'd like you to name some of these problems, and for each one I'd like you to tell me whether you think we're spending too much money on it, too little money, or about the right amount. First (READ ITEM A) . . . are we spending too much, too little, or about the right amount on (ITEM)? Q. Supporting scientific research Choices: 1-TOO LITTLE, 2-ABOUT RIGHT, 3-TOO MUCH

How firm are you about your opinion on abortion--would you say you are very likely to change your opinion, somewhat likely to change, somewhat unlikely to change or very unlikely to change? Choices: 1-CHANGE VERY LIKELY, 2-SOMEWHAT LIKELY, 3-SOMEWHAT UNLIKELY, 4-CHANGE VERY UNLIKELY

We are faced with many problems in this country, none of which can be solved easily or inexpensively. I'm going to name some of these problems, and for each one I'd like you to name some of these problems, and for each one I'd like you to tell me whether you think we're spending too much money on it, too little money, or about the right amount. First (READ ITEM A) . . . are we spending too much, too little, or about the right amount on (ITEM)?
P. Assistance for childcare Choices: 1-TOO LITTLE, 2-ABOUT RIGHT, 3-TOO MUCH

I am going to name some institutions in this country. As far as the people running these institutions are concerned, would you say you have a great deal of confidence, only some confidence, or hardly any confidence at all in them? Organized religion.  Choices: 1-A GREAT DEAL, 2-ONLY SOME, 3-HARDLY ANY

How important is the law enforcement issue to you--would you say it is one of the most important, important, not very important, or not important at all? Choices: 1-ONE OF MOST IMP, 2-IMPORTANT, 3-NOT VERY IMP, 4-NOT IMPORTANT

What about having a close relative marry a Jewish person? Would you be very in favor of it happening, somewhat In favor, neither in favor nor opposed to it happening, somewhat opposed, or very opposed to it happening? D. An Hispanic American person? Choices: 1-STRONGLY FAVOR, 2-FAVOR, 3-NEITHER FAVOR NOR OPPOSE, 4-OPPOSE, 5-STRONGLY OPPOSE

I am going to name some institutions in this country. As far as the people running these institutions are concerned, would you say you have a great deal of confidence, only some confidence, or hardly any confidence at all in them? B. Major companies Choices: 1-A GREAT DEAL, 2-ONLY SOME, 3-HARDLY ANY
In general, do you find life exciting, pretty routine, or dull? Choices: 1-Exciting, 2-Routine, 3-Dull

What about the number of immigrants from Europe? (should it be increased a lot, increased a little, left the same as it is now, decreased a little, or decreased a lot?) Choices: 1-INCREASED A LOT, 2-INCREASED A LITTLE, 3-LEFT THE SAME AS IT IS NOW, 4-DECREASED A LITTLE, 5-DECREASED A LOT

Now I want to read you some things some people have told us they have felt from time to time. Do you tend to feel or not . . . (READ LIST) A. The people running the country don't really care what happens to you. Choices: 1-FEEL, 2-NOT FEEL
Taking things all together, would you say that your relationship with your partner is very happy, pretty happy, or not too happy? Choices: 1-Very happy, 2-Pretty happy, 3-Not too happy

Now I have some questions about different groups in our society. I'm going to show you a seven-point scale which the characteristics of people in a group can be rated. In the first statement a score of 1 means that you think almost all of the people in that group are "rich." A score of 7 means that you think almost everyone in the group are "poor." A score of 4 means that you think that the group is not towards one end or another, and of course you may choose any number in between that comes closest to where you think people in the group stand. B1. Legal immigrants? Choices: 1-HARD-WORKING, 7-LAZY
